# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Given the task and special instructions, here's the `wrap_string` function implementation:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    words = split(text, r"\s+"))
    wrapped_text = ""

    for (index, word) in enumerate(words)
        if index > 0 && width_of(wrapped_text) + length(word) + 1 > text_width) # Adding 1 for space between words
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
        end

        wrapped_text *= word * (index == lastindex(words)))
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```
Example usage:
```julia
text = "This is a very long sentence that we want to wrap into multiple lines so it's more readable."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
The `wrap_string` function will split the input text into lines, respecting the specified `text_width`.
